Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: Awesome 3-night stay. Extremely friendly staff, clean room, powerful A/C, and a varied breakfast that saves both time and money. My spouse and I were recommended this hotel by the Rick Steves book, and we were not disappointed. 10-15 minute walk from Piazza San Marco or the Rialto Bridge, it is located in a legitimate Venice neighbourhood, which lets you get away from the action at the end of the day and see how the locals live. Anyone who had trouble getting there: It was a simple waterbus ride, followed by a 2 minute walk. Granted, it was towards the end of the route, but getting there requires little effort. I would recommend this hotel, without question, to anyone looking for an affordable and good-quality room in a famously pricey city.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Alexa K
Reviews.Content: Alloggi Barbaria was a great choice for a B&B for our stay in Venice. My friend and i were only in Venice for one day and night, and were pleased with both the room and the breakfast offerred in the morning on the last day of our stay. In another review i read that it was hard to nativate to this B&B because of the alleyways and canals - that is not Alloggi Barbaria's fault, this is how the Venice city is designed! My friend and i actually had to get off at the San Marco waterbus stop, and a nice waterbus employee navigated us right to the B&B so we wouldn't get lost. We found our way back to the B&B easily with the help of a map given to us by Georgio, the concierge during our stay, who also marked the map for where the Rialto Bridge and other sites were so we could find them easily. Fausto was also very accomodating through the process of booking the room and providing us with transportation details from the airport/train station to the B&B and vice versa. Georgio let us keep our baggage at the B&B during the day before our departure so we wouldn't have to take anything with us. All in all, a very nice stay - safe, clean, affordable, and friendly - and i recommend to anyone visiting Venice in the future!

Reviews.Title: “As local as you can get”
Reviews.Author: Svitlana_K2012
Reviews.Content: When it comes to Venice, this B&B made me fall in love with Venice. If it wasn't for the amazing people there, I would probably never consider returning to Venice again. This placed felt like you were part of an Italian family, the older man (I believe Georgio), was extremely nice, caring and sweet. The other concierge, Fausto, was extremely helpful as his English was a lot better. The B&B itself, very clean, you get your own shower, bathroom, bide, heating/ac that you can adjust to your liking, TV, fridge and free Wifi. Your towels are changed daily and you get proper service. The breakfast is actually quite nice, you get a yogurt (varies daily!), a coffee/tea, a croissant or a little cake and bread to go with some butter, jam and nutella....if you ask me, that can get you a massive savings in Venice (food in Venice is rather pricey, so Thank you for the breakfast!) I stayed there for 4 nights and the place was easy to find, with a supermarket in close proximity and a 10minute walk to St. Marco's square. It is off the beaten path and their recommendations about restaurants were great (not only did I eat at local places, I also paid local pricey and really enjoyed the food!), Overall, I think this place is a great value, very clean and well placed (it is near the fondamento nove boat stop so if you want to go to Murano, Burano or Torcello, it is a 10 min walk along the water to get to the bus stop).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value B&B in Venice”
Reviews.Author: mollybeatrice
Reviews.Content: This B&B hit every note important to me in a hotel: it was clean, located off the beaten tourist track but still within walking distance to important sites, and very large by European standards. The room was quite large, as was the bathroom. A few people have complained about finding the hotel, but if you follow their directions EXACTLY, it's not a problem at all (on a side note - I'm not sure if the reviewer AdaRomania were staying at this B&B - it's definitely NOT an extra boat ride from Ospedale. I can't think where they ended up! And to my memory, there were never any women at reception, only an older owner with little English and a younger man who was very friendly). Overall, we were extremely pleased with our stay and would absolutely stay here again. And for people who complain about the breakfast - consider it leaving room for all the great cichetti in the neighborhood!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Alloggi Barbaria”
Reviews.Author: CarlyDallas
Reviews.Content: The best 2 star I have ever stayed at! The people who give this a bad review have to keep in mind that this is a 2 star. And for a 2 star it is very clean and the people who work there very nice. Most people can't afford to spend 300 dollars a night so for just over 100 bucks you can't beat it! I would stay there again and really liked the staff who worked there.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Venice B&B”
Reviews.Author: ajd83
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights with our 1 year old son recently. It was fairly basic but good value for money in what is a really expensive city. We arrived early (about 9:30am) and were allowed to check in immediately which was appreciated. The hotel is easy to find with the directions shown on the website. Location is great, a short but lovely walk to the Rialto Bridge/Grand Canal & San Marco. Staff are very friendly (however the older gentleman doesn't speak great English-not that we expected that though). Our room was fairly clean (a bit of dust under the bed but nothing I would make a fuss about). They were very accommodating with an extra bed for our son too. The biggest downfall of this place is probably the breakfast. As many other reviews have mentioned, the tea/coffee is lukewarm. Not from a boiling kettle that's for sure. And the bread rolls are stale. Overall though, if we came back to Venice we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Only good thing is the location. Still not worth it though.”
Reviews.Author: seattlefunfun
Reviews.Content: I was torn when choosing a place in Venice. I did not end up choosing wisely. It was a very convenient location to get on and off the the water taxi's but once we walked down the dirty dark alley and entered the cold sterile environment we were greatly disappointed. The greeter girl was very pleasant. Basically your walking into the dining area and right there also is the check in counter and rooms. The rooms are VERY VERY small. While the bathroom was clean the floors were very dusty and the walls were banged up. Could use a fresh coat of paint. It did not seem to me the bed coverings were clean, grossed me out pretty bad. I was glad we were only staying 1 night. The worse part was the breakfast. Absolutely HORRIBLE!!! The coffee was instant! AND I swear it was made from hot tap water not boiling water. Also was served was a stale roll along with butter and jam. DIdnt even touch it. We got up, checked out and was SOOOO happy to leave. It was cheap, you get what you pay for I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Very hard to locate”
Reviews.Author: Woodstock1968
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on both trip advisor and Frommer's. This was our first trip to Italy and Venice was our first stop. Candidly, I didn't really have a good context when I booked it but it seemed like it was a great find. Finding it was the hard part! We received bad information at the Venice airport on what water shuttle to take and wound up getting off on the opposite side of the island. We then had trouble getting our bearings. If it wasn't for two kind painters on the street, we still might be trying to find the hotel since no one knew about it. Once we found the hotel, we got settled in. It's basically more of a rooming house or bed and breakfast rather than a hotel since there's only about six rooms. However, the room was relatively clean and comfortable. The bathroom was fine but the shower was very small. There is no elevator so you will need to carry your luggage up the stairs. The breakfast in the morning was ok - basically yogurt and rolls. My wife wasn't happy with the coffee - she thought it was instant. If you are on a budget or want something out of the way, then you'll be ok here. Just make sure you get off at the Ospendale stop for the water shuttle. If you have a few more bucks

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Venice”
Reviews.Author: amy m
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic place to stay in Venice. Very convenient to water taxi stops, and a bonus as one of the taxi's first stops and good spot to get the Murano taxis. Also close to the hospital. Walkable to everything in Venice but enough off the track to be quiet and uncrowded. Fausto Maroder is very nice and helpful, as is the staff. They recommended a great local restaurant which was our home restaurant (name escapes me). Spacious room and bathroom, especially for European standards (I've stayed in places where you could only open a suitcase on top of the bed). Very clean and well-kept. Cheap (and very drinkable) wine in the room fridge. I will definitely stay here next time I'm in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Mariawanless
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in september 2011 had an excellent time staff are wonderful really helpfull location is great breackfast was good rooms clean value for money easy access to vaporeto stop for aorport and train station would recomend

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean rooms, and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: uasindhu
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Alloggi for 2 nights from September 29 - Oct 1. It was very convenient to get to from the vaporetto stop "Ospedale". On your way , you can stop by the supermarket to buy fruits, water , etc. The b&b itself is pretty good. We had the last room on the corridor. The room itself was huge, clean and cozy. The bathroom was clean and huge as well. The staff is very helpful, especially Fausto. The breakfast is adequate. Some reviewers complained about the noise. We didn't experience any noise, it could be due to the location our room. The b&b is conveniently located to the famous landmarks such as San Marco. You ought to get lost a few times , but that's the fun part strolling along the narrow streets of Venice. There's a donor kabab and a great bakery just walking distance to the b&b. If you can't find your way back, just ask or look for "Ospedale" sign in 'blue'. Overall, the b&b is good and we'll recommend it. We enjoyed our stay there will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Pat C
Reviews.Content: For 2 bemused Venice first timers, the staff here were so kind, thoughtful and helpful; their lovely attitude and excellent English, (compared with our awful Italian) really made a difference. The hotel and rooms are comfortable and clean with space for everything and everything you need from the space-air-con., fridge and minibar were the standouts for us! Getting there and out and about is easy, as another reviewer says, Alloggi Barbaria is perfectly positioned for both the vaporetto and strolls into the hotspots but is in a quiet, friendly area. Highly recommended for the budget conscious!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay with a couple of caveats”
Reviews.Author: pdotie
Reviews.Content: First off, myself and my wife have just returned from an excellent stay in Venice at the Alloggi Barbaria. Having stayed, I can now understand why this place gets so many polarised reviews. The room. It is basic, very basic, BUT, it has air-conditioning, a fridge, a comfortable (if a little creaky) bed, a spotlessly clean bathroom, TV, hot water in the shower and a safe. It is not luxurious, nor romantic in any way, but if you want that you are looking in the wrong price bracket for Venice. The only thing it could have benefited from was a kettle. The breakfast. It is basic, very basic, BUT, a couple of bread rolls and cream cheese or jam, a little cake, a yoghurt and tea/coffee are enough to just get you going in the morning. A couple of slices of salami or mortadella would have gone down well, but the breakfast was fine without it. The location. It is off the main tourist strip, in a relatively residential part of town. This has good points and bad points. The bad points are not really that bad, as they are in fact good points in my book, however others may find the fact that it is a whole 15 mins walk from St Marks Square or the Rialto bridge a hardship. I found the fact that it was in the residential area meant that it had quite a few cheap and good quality osteria within a couple of minutes walk, and it was easy to escape the tourist throng walking around. The fact that it is located near the outside of the city means that the transfer from the airport is very easy. Either take the Alilaguna water bus direct from the Airport to Fodamente Nova or Ospedale, or take the airport bus, and then the 52 Vaporetto to Ospedale, and it is a 3 min walk. In conclusion, Allogi Barbaria is the perfect place to stay if you are not fussed about luxury or paying over the odds for a centrally located hotel in Venice and all you want is a place to lay your head after a days walking and taking in the sights. The facilities are similar to a top end hostel but with private, ensuite and clean rooms and a basic breakfast. The fact that it is on the main island is a big plus, avoiding the need to pay for Vaporetto just to get to-and-from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like we were in the state penitentiary!”
Reviews.Author: aj
Reviews.Content: Hmm. I don't know why this place gets good reviews. I'm not one to stay at fancy schmancy places but this one I couldn't even stay more then 1 night, and I'm used to European hotels. 1st the good- fridge and air conditioning, big bathroom The bad - dirty bed cover. Thought I would look in closet for another to put on top- guess what, another dirty one that was just thrown in there not even folded. Itsy bitsy room- small for even Europe with nothing in it- white dirty walls, no view Dirty floor Breakfast- what a joke, instant coffee in hot tap water, 1 stale roll, twinky like thing in package, that's it. Room was in breakfast dining area with tables next to door, heard everyone in morning. Like I said, we left early and still paid for whole stay, it was worth it just to get out of there. Don't say I didn't warn you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in a Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Kristin D
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay in this hotel. It is located away from the main attractions, but we rather enjoyed the peace and quiet at night after a long day of visting St. Mark's Basicilla and the Rialto Bridge. The rooms are spacious and very clean. Breakfast is served and the price is great for Venice. I would recommend this hotel for visitors to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “nice, clean, affordable, quiet”
Reviews.Author: nuevodia
Reviews.Content: Good b&b for those on a budget. discounted with Rick Steve's book. The man that is at the main office and arranges breakfasts, does not speak too much english, but is very helpful and of course, we should try to speak Italian when in Italy right? :) It is clean and the location is a bit difficult to find (as is any place in Venice) But with the help of mapquest (not google maps - that one was off), it was pretty straight forward. The website picture of the location is kinda off, it is midway between rialto bridge and st marks square but near the top edge away from the main sights. Its a nice walk through Venice to get the main sights. The breakfast is enough to give you a tiny bit of energy in the morning - a very small continental breakfast. Unfortunately the coffee is warm - I think it may have been hot water from the tap? So if you are a coffee conessieour (sp) then dont count of the breakfast. (though from what I read this is how Italian breakfasts seem to be in most hotels ) There is a bit of stairs to walk up from the front door - there is a lift but I think it is more for wheelchair access? It is clean and has AC. great budget place and quiet enough from the noisy touristy areas.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended, great value”
Reviews.Author: MegSCL
Reviews.Content: I was really happy with this hotel. It is in a nice quiet area of Venice, but still an easy walk to all the main sites (and walking around this pretty area is a pleasure anyway). It was right near a water bus stop too if you don't like to walk. We got the triple room and it was very large and spacious with two double beds and had a good air conditioner and a mini fridge. The staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We highly recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: byboettger
Reviews.Content: We found Alloggi Barbaria to be just right for our overnight stay in Venice for our family of 5. The location was just a short walk to the action at St. Mark's Square, the room was clean and quiet, and the hosts were very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean, nice accommodations away from the tourist mobs”
Reviews.Author: DBAat2C
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely little pensione on a quiet street far away from the tourists and craziness of Piazza San Marco. The room was clean and good sized with tall ceilings and windows that opened onto a lovely courtyard. The managers were lovely and helpful. The only downside was the terrible breakfast. Plan on eating out. There is a great grocery store just down the street that is a much better alternative!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: acraw42
Reviews.Content: Great place, good location,wonderful staff. We really enjoyed our stay here. It was close to the vaporetta stop, about 10 walk to San Marco, as long as you didn't make a wrong turn, we did. Delightful owners, helpful, friendly and acommodating .Breakfast was good and the room was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: bobmarra
Reviews.Content: Staying with our very helpful hosts, Giorgio and Fausto at their very comfortble and convenient Alloggi Barbaria helped to make our family's first visit to Venice an unforgettable experience. It was very easy to travel between the train station and the hotel by vaparretto. There was a nice supermarket a 100 yards away. It did take longer than 10 minutes to walk to San Marco and the Rialto Bridge but that was because there were so many extraordinary shops, churches and oher sights on our way. One of these is our now favorite bookstore in the world complete with a very friendly and helpful owner, a real gondola in the store filled with books and a open back door directly onto one ot the canals. If we are fortunate enough to return to Venice we would hope to stay again at the Alloggi Barbaria.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, a bit out of the way, and a great value.”
Reviews.Author: The2McDoos
Reviews.Content: This is a bit hostel-ish, which was exactly what we were after -- a clean, spare room with private bath, breakfast, and free WiFi for a good price. Located on Calle del Cappucine just a short walk from the Ospedale vaporetto stop (take vaporetto #52), Alloggi Barbaria is a great home base while in Venice. Owner Giorgio speaks little English, but he is a gracious host; his English-speaking assistant Fausto is a great guy and was very helpful. Because of its slightly out of the way location, you get to wander through (and get a good sense of) "the real Venice" where people live and work. The hotel provides an excellent map, which is great for getting around during the day. At night, without the sun to provide a sense of direction, we relied on my husband's iPhone compass in addition to the map.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel spotlessly clean, warm and well situated for walking everywhere”
Reviews.Author: Fairchild2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel really liked room and bathroom friendly staff, location great can walk everywhere. Also Venice was quite cold in Feb and the room was really warm. Shower good with lashings of hot water. Owner pointed us to some great restaurants round corner. Much better than in tourist area. Really looked after us. Had better sleep here than had for a long time.Breakfast fine to get you going. Really close to waterbus for airport and to islands. Would definately stay again. Good budget hotel defnately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very adequate and a good bargain”
Reviews.Author: julie248
Reviews.Content: I do recommend Alloggi Barbaria, mainly for the price and the good service from Fausto (who is there in the afternoons, but we never met in person) and Giorgio (who is there in mornings and evenings). Giorgio is not fluent in English, but he does quite well at communicating since he speaks much more English than I do Italian. He was very kind and made sure that any issues we had were addressed, which goes a long way in my book. The hotel is up one flight of stairs from the street and is all on one floor (the rooms, the breakfast area, the terrace) with all of the rooms opening off of the breakfast and kitchen area. The neighborhood is very quiet with little street noise or bells, etc. Our rooms overlooked a pleasant little patio next door. Positives: 1. Not right in the center of the Venice craziness. However, the craziness is less of an issue in January - the city was quite sedate while we were there. However, if acqua alta is a concern, apparently this area is less likely to flood than other more central areas. It took a leisurely 10-15 minutes to reach Piazza San Marco from the hotel. And the hotel is also positioned well to reach Rialto. If you're going to stay farther out from San Marco, I recommend this area since you're just a bit east rather than being farther north or south, which makes reaching the tourist sites more of a hike. 2. Very convenient and easy to find via vaporetto from the train station and then a short walk. This is very nice when you're not yet familiar with the twisty streets of Venice. Also very convenient to go to Murano and Burano from here. 3. Very good service from Giorgio. We had two rooms in the hotel (out of 6, I believe). My room was a comfortable temperature, but my mother's room did not get warm overnight. When it was still a problem the next day, Giorgio called in a service man to tune up the boiler and the temperature problem was fixed. We really appreciated that he worked it out quickly and fixed the problem during our stay. 4. Each room had a mini-fridge stocked with beverage choices at fair prices. We brought home some yogurt and juice to bring on the train with us, and it was nice to have a place to keep food cold overnight. 5. Great price. Negatives: 1. My room had a vague sewage smell coming from the shower drain. It got better if I left the shower stall closed. However, I am odor-sensitive (so it may not have bothered other people; in fact, my mother did not notice it when she was in my room), and it was not a huge problem for me. And I noticed the same odor other places in Venice, so I think it's more of an institutional problem with all the water in the city than a problem with this hotel. 2. The breakfast was rather meager. I had read this in other reviews, but it is true. The only beverage on offer was coffee, with one roll, one packaged croissant, and some butter/jam/cream cheese packets. I am more of a cereal and juice girl, so I got hungry for lunch early. Still, for the price, it's hard to complain too much about this. 3. The hotel has everything I require, but it is not super plush or fancy. It's fairly bare bones, though the rooms have plenty of space, which was a surprise in crowded Venice. But the bed was comfortable, the shower warm, and it was a nice place to stay. The helpfulness of the owners goes a long way to compensate for the minor drawbacks. All in all, I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charm of Venice - Convenience of Location”
Reviews.Author: jamespyarbrough
Reviews.Content: Staying at the hotel Alloggi Barbaria, hosted by Fausto and Giorgio, during our first trip to Venice was a brilliant introduction into the authentic traveling experience in Europe we seek. Interaction with knowledgeable hosts able to guide us to culinary, cultural and historical points, a location that made local travel extremely easy and interaction with native Venetians seamless. The accommodations were basic and comfortable with a suitable basic breakfast. Restaurants and shops that catered to the neighborhood were pleasing. A great introduction to this Italian city.

Reviews.Title: “Our Venice Pension”
Reviews.Author: kcirtap_4243
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Alloggi Barbaria on 4 out of our 5 trips to Venice. We love that it is located in a neighborhood away from the main tourist areas - its quiet and it helped us explore areas we may have never seen. The rooms are basic, but very clean and spacious. The breakfasts are basic (croissant, tea, coffee, rolls) but they get the day started. The location is great for catching boats to Murano, Burano, then airport and the main train station. It is also very easy to find your way to the main tourist areas - Rialto and San Marco. If you are looking for a clean room for a moderate to low price (Venice can be expensive) and don't need the frills of a hotel, this is the place. We plan to stay here again when family visits us in Italy and for Carnevale.

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel. It is a very basic B&B!”
Reviews.Author: globle_trotter
Reviews.Content: Alloggi Barbaria is a family-run B&B (I would not consider it as a hotel) located in a quiet residential area. Easy access to water bus and about 15 mins walk to San Marco Square. Nearest water bus pier services until 10pm only, expect to walk further after 10pm. Very small entrance in a small road so make sure you have a proper map on hands. Gotta take 10+ stairs from entrance to the lobby/ rooms, it is not nice for those with heavy luggages or walking difficulty. Old basic rooms but some rooms are newly refurbished so better arrive early to pick a better room. The host was friendly but could barely speak English. Breakfast was the worst I've ever had - only one packaged sweet croissant + tea/ coffee - they both taste very bad. Refilling hot water from tap directly, not from kettle, so tea & coffee not serving hot enough, that's disappointing. We ended up having our breakfast outside next day. Wifi is available by external provider - you gotta call them for payment and connection but unfortunately they didn't pick up my phone call. If you are just looking for somewhere basic to sleep, this is a place. Considering paying EUR130 for a night, I would expect somewhere better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: hadiwi56a
Reviews.Content: Was given a large room with an extra single bed which we did not require. This hotel is in a quieter area of Venice, plenty of small restaurants nearby which are frequented by locals. While not in the touristy area, it is not hard to go to San Marco with the printed guide provided by reception. Friendly reception staff, breakfast is very basic, but not a problem for us. It is also handy if you want to take the Alilaguna line to Marco Polo airport.

Reviews.Title: “Allogi Barbaria, a great hotel, in a fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: smo231
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife would like to thank the very friendly staff at Alloggi Barbaria for the excellent service during our stay in September 2010. The hotel is situated perfectly between the airport and the main attractions in Venice where the waterbuses both from the airport and the railway station stop close to the hotel AND it is only a 10 minutes walk to either San Marco square or Rialto bridge. The room was spacious with a nice bathroom, clean, a well working AC and we got a personal attention from staff that you will not find at bigger hotels. We were equipped with a map over Venice and a instruction of the quickest way to and from San Marco square from the hotel. We still got lost but that is part of the charm in Venice and the locals are more than willing to point you in the right direction. In the neighborhood we were able to experience the atmosphere of the `real` Venice with restaurants and bars a little bit outside the normal tourist track., where local people go out and have their evening dinners and drink coffee. It is also a perfect location for trips to islands of Murano, Burano and Torecello. If you want to have a nice stay in Venice, a little bit outside the beaten tourist track, Alloggi Barbaria will be the prefect choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brnp
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near Ospadale in a nice, quiet, not so touristy area. Not too far from Rialto/San Marco. The room looked new and in excellent condition and was huge. We also liked the breakfast - it was basic but a good value. The old gentleman was very helpful and took great care of us. The hotel is well connected to the train station and airports. Very good hotel if you prefer a nice, quiet area not too far from tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, friendly and a bit out of the main area”
Reviews.Author: Jill32
Reviews.Content: Venice is expensive so expect to pay a lot for anything within the city. This hotel is about a 15 min walk from St Mark's Square. It's a bit of a distance from all the main attractions but we liked that because it was quieter. The staff are really friendly although the older gentlemen doesn't speak very good English. Breakfast was simple and the same every day. The room we stayed in was quite big. I would recommend this hotel for anyone on a budget and who isn't too concerned about 5 star living.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: maxpixel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alloggi Barbaria for three nights in March. We had a room for three people with a large queen sized bed and a single bed. Rooms were clean and spacious and the area of the city was very quiet. It is about a 10 minute walk to St. Mark's Square. It is also about 200 feet from the Fondamente Nuovo for trips to Burano and Murano and the local grocery store. Take the vaporetto to Oespidale (Hospital). Breakfast is basic, coffee great.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay At "Alloggi Barbaria" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bellapasta6
Reviews.Content: The area of this hotel is quiet and perfectly situated to see the islands of Murano & Burano with the waterbus just a short walk, and also this stop takes you straight back to Marco Polo Airport, their is also a supermarket just ask in the hotel where you will find the owners to be most helpfull and friendly. Then a walk through the streets past the local shops and over the famous bridges of Venice will take you up to the front of the island and St Marks square you will almost certainly get lost in these streets but dont worry just enjoy the locals are also very friendly and will point you in the right direction. Can I just say If you arrive late at night ask for waterbus tickets to Ospendale stop where you will find the hotel just a short walk. Enjoy!!!!!!!!!!!!! we did.

Reviews.Title: “For an city break this place is perfect.”
Reviews.Author: MartinBov
Reviews.Content: My fiance and i stayed here for three nights . It was our first time in Venice and i booked a room based on the reccomendations of other people on Trip Advisor, we were not dissapointed. The hotel is actually a B&B but dont let that put you off. On arriving we were greeted and showed straight to our room and given the relevant infomation about breakfast and how to work the remote for the air conditioning, we were also given a map of Venice with the hotel and all the main sights marked. The security is excellent, we were given a key ring with three keys, one for the front door which stays locked 24/7 then one for our room and one for a safe built into the wall in the room (this is free of charge unlike some more expesive hotels). The room was clean and tidy with a good shower and the bed was comfortouble enough, although it was two singles pushed together. There was a mini fridge that got re-stocked every day with water beer and soft drinks. For our entire stay we never saw the cleaner, but every time we returned it was evident they had been and done a good job. The breakfast was a simple affair, fresh warm bread rolls, tea/coffee a pre packed quassiont with a selection of cream cheese, butter and jam. At a first glance the location dosnt seem to hot for all the main sights, but you quickly become aware of how small Venice is. We were about a ten minute walk form St Marks Square and the Rialto Bridge. A 30 second walk out of the door and you are looking accross the water to Murano (where Venician Glass is made) and a furthar five minutes along the front and there are some really nice restaurants with amazing views while you eat. Again just out of the front door and there are three water bus stops which take you direct to and from the airport and the islands of Murano and Burano and also into the heart of Venice. To conclude if you are on a budget or backpacking the Alloggi Barbaria has everything to offer. Clean, comfortable, friendly, good location and at a good price. Even if you are not on a budget i would recomend this Hotel for a city break. You wont get any better for around 85 Euros for a double room per night.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for the price, more of a local theme.”
Reviews.Author: whatsnewski
Reviews.Content: Five of us stayed here for three nights prior to our Princess cruise departure. Easy short boat ride from Marco Polo airport. On your walk to the major tourist attractions, within 2-3 minutes are local services, Internet, bakery, restaurants away from the main stream of St Marks traffic and tourist hiked prices. Had two units (double, triple) for 5 adults, triple divided into two sleeping areas. Basic clean no frills needs as to room, but great personal attention from the staff. Their web site description is right on.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean, close to Vaporetto”
Reviews.Author: betsmith38
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Alloggia Barbaria July 25, 26, 27, 2009 and for an inexpensive hotel, it was very nice. It was a very short distance from the vaporetto and easy to find. It was quiet, clean, the hot water was hot, the shower drained, etc. The breakfast was very simple, coffee, packaged roll, cream cheese, butter. Unfortunately, the english speaking young man I corresponded with on the phone was not there when we were there, but we had no trouble communicating with the pleasant Italian man who was on duty. We were two grandparents traveling with two granddaughters 19 and 17 years of age. It was within waking distance to St. Marks and just about everywhere else. The price was $120 euros for four people including taxes and breakfast. Not fancy, but comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Alloggi Barbaria is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Sevant4Christ
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful two day stay in Venice in May and I can't say enough good things about the Alloggi Barbaria Hotel. I have high standards and staying here was a fantastic experience for our family. Fausto was so friendly and helpful, both during our stay and many times before we came (through all my emails to him). Not only was the hotel great but the location is great. It's very close to a water bus stop and close enough to St. Mark's Square to be convenient. The walk to St. Mark's is short but full of pretty streets, canals, and squares and this enhances your visit. We got a great restaurant recommendation which was one of the highlights of our visit. You will be very happy you choose Alloggi Barbaria and the price is right for Venice. I don't understand the reviewer who complained about this hotel. Sounds like great exaggeration on the negative side and they overlooked the great personal service and charm of this fine establishment. Fausto, who was born and raised in Venice so he knows it well, bent over backwards to help our stay be a dream come true visit to Venice and he will do the same for you if you give him the chance! Among other things, he arranged a romantic gondola serenade that our family will treasure forever. By the way, both of our rooms were spacious and extremely clean.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: steve-034
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed here a couple of nights, at the tail end of our almost 4-week vacation. We were traveling on a limited budget, which explains our decision to stay here - Venice is very expensive, this place not so much. I've read reviews where people refer to this hotel with superlatives such as the "Best B&B in Italy", or even with praise such as "excellent", "lovely", "perfect", "fabulous", etc. Frankly, it is none of those. What it is, is a inexpensive, not-terribly located, reasonable place to crash at the end of a long day of walking Venice. This hotel is close to the Ospedale water bus station, and about a 15 minute walk to most of the main points of interest. It is also on a quiet, somewhat dark alleyway, but we didn't feel concerned at all for safety. The truth is that Venice is a fabulous city to walk around in, so the location of the hotel didn't bother us. The room was also very spacious, and had an air conditioner that worked quite nicely. The younger of the two hosts (the gentleman with glasses) was very friendly and welcoming when we arrived, and provided us with maps and walking directions for the city, as well as recommendations on sights of potential interest. The hotel is very close to a supermarket, which is great if you want to save some money on food, or even just pick up a couple of things for a snack. Those are the positives. What was not very nice was the cleanliness (or lack thereof) of the bathroom: the shower had mold growing on it, and it had very clearly been a long time since it had received a proper, thorough cleaning (although I would believe it if you told me that it was rinsed down with water each day when the custodial staff cleaned the room). Our bed was actually two small beds pushed together, and sloped toward the middle. In addition, it was not especially comfortable. Since we were only really using the hotel as a place to sleep and shower, the fact that it disappointed in both of those areas was unfortunate, to say the least. Also problematic was the second half of the "B&B": even by the most liberal and inclusive definition, you cannot possible call the offensive display that was placed in front of us each morning breakfast. "Breakfast" consisted of one pre-packaged jelly-filled croissant each, a small bowl of crusty, Pillsbury-style rolls, and the worst coffee I have ever been served, anywhere (which was especially disappointing given that we were in Italy). Suffice it to say that we ate a mid-morning shack within 30 minutes of leaving the hotel each day. So, in sum, what you get if you stay here: a cheap room in a not-inconvenient location. What you do not get: a nice room, a clean bathroom, a good breakfast. I would recommend this B&B to two groups: people who are looking for a very cheap, no-frills place to stay in Venice, and people that I don't like very much. We would certainly never stay here again, nor would I sincerely and in good conscience be able to recommend it. Even at the budget end, there simply has to be a better option.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: susansteve
Reviews.Content: We know Venice is expensive, however, this was our most expensive B&B in our 9 week trip of Italy, England and Ireland. Having said that, it was also the worst breakfast - give it a miss. Prepackaged croissants (use by date 2011) gritty horrid coffee, just don't bother. The young mine host was very nice and helpful, his dad? a bit too attentive. You can tell this place is run by 2 men - clean (but not quite). Great location, and very quiet - easy to get to via vaporetto from railway station, and very handy supermarket. Walking distance to all that Venice has - which is pretty fantastic. Given how expensive Venice is - this is a good option, just don't worry about breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Best B&B in Italy”
Reviews.Author: shweta_cu
Reviews.Content: Great location - is 10 min walk from San Marco square, but in a very quiet neighborhood. It is far away from the touristic places but not too far from the main attractions. Very close to the vaperetto, and also to the other islands of Murano, Burano, and Lido. Great host - Very friendly and helpful host. Rooms - The rooms were the best in Italy - great air conditioning which is rare in Europe. Clean rooms, bathrooms also nice. And satellite TV - you can listen to english channels which is very rare in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: calgirl28
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights in May and loved it! We arrived early after a horrible overnight train ride and we were exhausted. We got to the hotel at 10am and our room wasn't supposed to be ready until 12pm. Instead of making us leave and come back, they gave us a different room - one that was meant for 4 people (2 twins/1 double). It was perfect!! The room was huge, bright, super clean and the washroom was nice and big. Even if you don't get the quad room, we walked by the others and they are almost just as big. The hotel was 2 minutes away from the COOP - a supermarket filled with everything you could need. We bought water and fruits which we kept in the fridge in our room. I also think there was free wireless but we didn't bring a laptop, so I'm not positive. The location was great, but I would recommend taking the water taxi if you're coming from the train station. It's quite the walk if you don't. If you take the taxi, get off at the Ospendale station and it's literally a 5 minute walk. St. Mark's Square is about 10 - 15 minutes away, but it's a nice easy walk. The manager (can't remember his name - young guy with glasses) was super nice and helpful and spoke good english. The older gentleman couldn't speak english very well but was also very nice. Breakfast was simple but not bad - coffee, juice, croissant, and buns. I would highly recommend this hotel - you get a lot for a decent price. We went with another couple, but they stayed in a different hotel - their's was a lot closer to St. Mark's but the room was small and dark. If you're willing to walk the extra 5-10 minutes, I'd go with this hotel for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Great small place - with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Bocelot
Reviews.Content: We went for a 5 day "weekend" in Venice - 4 people with 2 kids - aged 14 & 11. Very friendly although breakfast a bit basic but stilll quite OK. Excellent new refurbished 4 person room, quiet surrounding close to COOP store & Ospedale and Fondamente Nuove vaporetto stations - the last being an advantage if you want to go to the islands. Giorgio recommends some pretty good eateries - with good food & not the tourist "fixed price" menu. All in all warmly reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “quiet, clean, convenient and friendly”
Reviews.Author: kimxtom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights before our cruise to Athens. The Allogi Barbaria is convenient to food, transportation and all the amazing sites of Venice and the surrounding islands. When we needed to take a break from the crowds, we enjoyed hanging out in the nearby Santa Maria Formosa Square. Fausto, the hotel manager, was very helpful. The only downside was the trek with the luggage from the Fondamente Nove waterbus stop. Try to see if you can get off at Osdedale instead (much closer without all the canal crossings).

Reviews.Title: “Recommended B&B in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Turasoirglic
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed by the management here. Helpful and friendly. Location is convenient to P. San Marco but is in a nice quiet location, close to the waterbus stop if required. Rooms are secure and comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Best quality/price ratio in Venice”
Reviews.Author: paulboop
Reviews.Content: ALLOGGI BARBARIA hotel VENICE BEST QUALITY /PRICE RATIO in Venice Ten minutes walk from the hustle and bustle of the Plaza San Marco brought us to the quiet peacefulness of a narrow street and this charming recently renovated small hotel reminiscent of what a B+B should be like. The rooms have good air /con ,modern bathrooms and adequate cupboards. The continental breakfast is a shade skimpy but thatâ€™s made up by the super â€“ friendly staff â€“and rates when for that quality are unbeatable in Venice. Paul +Boop : Canada â€“Thailand

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice!”
Reviews.Author: Vivyrom
Reviews.Content: I contacted Allogi through "hellovenice.com" and received a fast answer from Fausto. I reserved my stay 2 months before. The hotel is located in Castello district (typically Venetian, very nice!), the access from Santa Lucia train station is direct and only 22 minutes long. The hotel is 200 straight metres from the vaporetto stop. We had room 6 overlooking the alley. Huge and comfortable room and bathroom with videt. All new and with simple modern furniture. Spotless clean. Breakfast is the only weak point, very limited, only bread rolls, packaged butter, cream cheese, marmalades and a sweet croissant filled with raspberry gelly that was too sweet (and I love sweet things but this was the exception), but I took ham, sliced bread and crackers that I bought by myself and solved it. There is a fantastic supermarket 100 metres away, there you can buy everything you may need and keep it in the minifridge. Special mention to Fausto, the manager of the afternoon shift. Speaks perfect Spanish & English. He is an excellent host and guide, will provide you with a map & instructions on how to get to St Marks in 10 minutes and will answer all your questions. He is what every hotel should have, really helpful and so polite!!!! Congratulations on him! He loves his job. Allogi B. offers attractive value for money in Venice. Excellent location and please go to eat to Ostaria alla Staffa, a little pasta place run by its owners where you will feel at home and eat well and cheap. Fausto will guide you to it, 300 metres.

Reviews.Title: “Helped To Make My Wife's 50th Birthday Memorable”
Reviews.Author: Tim_Mahoney
Reviews.Content: I had already booked to stay here before I read the reviews. They were so go I didn't believe them, but they are true - it's a great place to stay. The directions on their website makes it easy to find the hotel Our room was large and clean and Giorgio and Fausto did all they could to be helpful, offering advice and directions. One of them is always available. Breakfast was just fruit juice (Fanta actually), rolls with butter, jam or cheese and choice of tea or coffee. Not a full English but we found it a great start to the day and I quite missed it when I got home. The location is right in the North of Venice but an easy walk to St Mark's or the Rialto (as long as you don't get lost). There's a Supermarket 150 yards away and other amenities within a few minutes walk, including restaurants and cafes. Ospedale vaporetto stop is about 200 yards away with access not only to Venice itself but also the islands of Murano, Burano and Torcello. Fondamente Nova stop, which is a main one on the island, is another three or four hundred yards. WARNING: Late at night the vaporettos tend not to stop at Ospedale but do stop at Fondamente Nova. On one occasion we found ourselves being taken to Murano and having to get the next boat back. At Fondamente Nova there are also some restaurants, gelateria and bars plus the all important Bancomat to get some Euros. The views from here over St Michelle and the lagoon are stunning bothe early morning and in the evening. We intend returning to Venice for the Carnival and/or Regatta and will definitely be booking into the Alloggi Barbaria

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Venice”
Reviews.Author: 4rick
Reviews.Content: My family of four spent two nights at ALLOGGI BARBARIA, it was difficult to find a room for four in (Europe) Venice but they accomidated us. Fausto shared local knowledge and gave us advice during our visit. Fausto went above and beyond when we had a problem with the Italian postal system (we don't speak Italian). The rooms are clean and comfortable and there is no bad location in Venice because it is so small. We came back to venice a week after we stayed with them and they allowed us to store our bags for a few hours - Amazing! Thank you again to the staff of Alloggi Barbaria!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: gelatoisyummy
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. Georgio and his staff were very sweet. Our room was quite spacious and clean. Great location as well. The hotel provides easy directions on getting there, and there were direction about getting around and to the airport in our room. It is in a cute quiet area of the city, close to a vapporetto station, but you can easily walk the city as well. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: prariegirlWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: Allloggi Barbaria is a great value for an expensive city such as Venice. It was only a 10 minute walk away from St Marks Square (can be a bit confusing to get there as the streets are so maze like-the staff supply you with a good map). I thought I would want to be closer, but after spending time in the crowds of people, I was happy to walk back to the hotel where it was nice and quiet. The room and bathroom were huge and they were very clean. It was nice to have a fridge as well for any leftovers or picnic supplies for the next day. Fausto and his father were very friendly and made great suggestions for places to eat. It was very easy to find our way to the hotel from the train station. The breakfast was okay, but the coffee was one of the best I had on my trip. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: jjrpaul
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights, and found the accomodations to be well worth the money. It is in a quiet neighborhood, but within reasonable walking distance to San Marco. The room was bright and clean, with a large bed, clean bathroom, cable TV, and a desk with chair. Fausto and Giorgio, the owners, were very friendly and helpful in recommending sights and in making us feel welcome. The only recommendation we would make is that the breakfasts, which are included in the price, be upgraded a bit. They featured only unappetizing rolls and pre-packaged croissants. We would recommend this hotel and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: FizzDublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. The room was bright, spacious and very clean. The bathroom, also very clean had a great shower and clean towels were supplied daily. There was a mini bar in the room which was stocked up with water, minerals and some alcoholic drinks. Breakfast was small but what you'd expect. The staff were friendly and very helpful, Giorgio recommended some great restaurant close by which were all very reasonably priced. The hotel was easy to find from Marco Polo airport and within walking distance to St. Mark's Square. I would certainly recommend this hotel to others and should I return to Venice I would have no problem staying in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel”
Reviews.Author: cjcYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Our welcome at the hotel was friendly, the rooms spacious and very clean, and with all that you need for a city break. The bathroom was modern and bright with clean towels daily, and the breakfast was simple yet more than adequate. The location of Alloggi Barbaria is very central yet away from the busy streets around the key sights of Venice. There are several excellant restaurants within a 5 minutes stroll and the ones we sampled were very reasonable and the food excellent. There is easy access to the vaparretto to/from the airport and then also to get around Venice and its islands. All in all excellent value for money and I'd give it 10/10 and would definitely return if we go back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value!”
Reviews.Author: ciewkui
Reviews.Content: Alloggi Barbaria is truly heaven sent. Located just away from the tourists focal points but a stone's throw from the main attractions, this B&B is inviting and makes the perfect base for your Venice holiday.. The room itself was spotless and generous with space, and the aircon was god-sent in the warm nights we were there. Giorgio was so helpful from the moment we arrived and we definitely have no qualms of returning again. Ciewkui Kuching, Malaysia

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: kriswiggs
Reviews.Content: Dollar for dollar, a great property in a great location of Venice. Offers everything you need - clean, great location, QUIET, convenient, and a great staff. We will stay there again next year, without a doubt! After reading about this property in Rick Steve's 2007 edition for Italy, we booked directly vis-a-vis the internet and fax confirmation. Our three rooms were ready for us upon our arrival from the train station. This place will save you big money in Venice, and provide you with a relaxing, comfortable, and convenient place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Big Bang for your Bucks”
Reviews.Author: LittleElm
Reviews.Content: This B&B is spacious for Euopean standards. The rooms were quiet, basic furniture, comfortable, very clean and safe. The showers were larger enough to move around in. The owners, Giorgio and Fausto, were very accomodating and personable. Our group rated them the best staff of all the places we stayed in Italy. You get a big bang for your buck here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Allogio Barbaria”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler44
Reviews.Content: Allogio Barbaria was the best accomodation we had during our 10 days in Italy. Fausto & Giorgio who operate this Inn are as friendly as family and went out of their way helping us in advance with restaurant reservations and activitiy suggestions. The rooms are emaculate with comfortable beds, large showers, great AC and the low priced, well stocked mini bar was used daily. They do have a minimal breakfast but the cost of the room was the lowest we had in our travels to Rome, Siena, Florence and Venice. Also, there are lovely markets with fresh fruit and cappuccino close at hand. Their location close to the Vaporetto minimizes the walking for weary travelers pulling bags over cobbles. I would not stay anywhere else on a return trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Not Sure Why This Place Received Such Glowing Reviews”
Reviews.Author: flowerwatersun
Reviews.Content: Our first reaction to the Alloggi Barbaria was "Yikes!". Yes, all the streets in Venice are basically alleys, but this B&B was in a tiny, dark alley. We didn't feel safe. Be prepared to drag your suitcases up 2 flights of stairs from the entrance to the "front desk". The guest rooms are situated around the main room where guests checked-in, came in and out, and had breakfast. Although the guests were courteous to keep their voices down, still, if someone just sneezed in the main room, you could hear it in your room. Guests received a set of keys to 1) their room, 2) the front door, and 3) the safe in their rooms which were chained to a heavy anchor. Not smart since the last thing travelers want is to add more weight onto themselves when exploring the city. We never used the safe since we didn't trust that we had the only key to it. We were told that we had to "slam" the front door to ensure that it shut, which was another safety concern for us. In hindsight, I would have paid more to stay at a better, safer place closer to the attractions. This B&B was quite far. I would recommend others to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo Fausto”
Reviews.Author: Colombo4850
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other reviews regarding the location, the ambience and the friendly location. The little supermarket just around the corner is a real plus in an expensive place like Venice. Fausto is a perfect host, friendly and helpful. Firmer beds and a fresh breakfast would make this place just about perfect

Reviews.Title: “Great little inn in Venice”
Reviews.Author: shpilka
Reviews.Content: We are 2 couples from Los Angeles and stayed in this hotel last week. Our friends recommended it to us and we glad we followed their advise. The stay was very pleasant. Innkeepers were very friendly and helped us with all our questions, vaporetto schedules and provided us walking map on how to get to San Marco. Free luggage storage was provided after checkout. Rooms were clean with refrigirators (you want to store a great vine that you could pour in the little shop just a few blocks away). Bathrooms were recently renovated with good appliances and fixtures. Hotel is very close to vaporetto stop Ospadale and about 15min. walk (if you know where to go to San Marco). Make sure you buy vaporetto pass, because each ride is 6E. Local food store is just 2 block away, so you could buy some snacks. You may need them because breakfast is not very large. Just a coffee, croussant, lemonade, bread and cream cheese. Another tricky thing is how to return back at night. make sure that you have a little flashlight with you to read the map, it may be tricky at times. Overall great place to stay for the money. Mention Rick Steves review (they are recommended for several years in the row) to get an extra dicount.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Find In Venice”
Reviews.Author: zntow2000
Reviews.Content: This was our first time traveling to Italy, but we are well traveled. We booked the Alloggi Barbaria direct via e-mail on a recommendation from the Rick Steveâ€™s Venice Guide Book. We picked it after reviewing many Venice Hotel websites. I donâ€™t think we could have picked a better hotel to stay at in Venice. The hotel operators, Fausto, his wife Yii, and Georgio were the most professional, helpful and kind business people that we met during our whole tour of Italy. As to not repeat all of the other reviews all just list all the great things about this place to save time and space: Easy to find-Vappotetto stops Ospedale or Nouve Good quiet neighborhood Just far enough from the tourist areas Walking distance to San Marco Close by excellent restaurants and groceries Large very clean rooms Excellent, friendly, professional helpful staff Modern Ikea type room furnishings Italian style at home atmosphere Easy communication Great value

Reviews.Title: “It's better than some say”
Reviews.Author: italianbiker
Reviews.Content: It was booked via Venere.com, a very good site to book hotels allover Italy. It was a pretty new hotel and they try to improve it. And they appreciate if you tell them if there are any problems why you are there. And it's not so hard to find it either by taxi-ferry or by foot following the signs to Ospedale Civile all the way from the centre of Venice. The hospital is just around the corner. The rooms are clean and spacious and if somebody had problems with insects they should close the windows why the lights are on. The nephew of the owner is very helpful and friendly and can give you lots if informations about his city. Anyway the breakfast could be better, for that it's a little overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Clean”
Reviews.Author: Island_Gen
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived and headed down an alley where this hotel was we were skeptical. My moth-in-law was upset that there were steep stairs to climb and no elevator, but hey, this was reasonably priced small inn and not a huge resort. The innkeeper was very nice and although his English was not good he tried hard. There was always someone at the property to help out and make suggestions. When the innkeeper was not there his nephew was. Our rooms were roomy enough for 2 and clean. A nice breakfast was served out on a balcony area each morning. This was a quite enjoyable place to stay and I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: AGW-Texas
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Alloggi Barbaria, and it was a wonderful experience! Within minutes of arriving, Fausto helped us with maps to a local pharmacy and clothing store (our luggage was delayed), a recommendation for dinner, and directions to the local internet cafe. All of the staff were wonderful! The room was spacious and clean. In particular, I was pleasantly surprised at the size of the bathroom although the shower itself was small. The location is about a 10 minute walk from St. Mark's, but has a nice neighborhood feel. It is quiet in the evenings, and there were several wonderful restaurants close by. Breakfast was simple, but good. I would highly recommend this hotel. I highly recommend the Alloggi Barbaria!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eve76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Alloggi Barbaria early September 2006 and before booking it, we took weeks to research all hotels, locations, and pricing. Trust me, this is the best value for the money! We found the directions from the hotel website very accurate when coming from the airport. Take the water shuttle as recommended, it's only 6 Euro per person, vs the water taxi, 80 Euro. The walk from the Fonte Nuoveva (spelling?) stop is about 10 minutes to the hotel. Start walking to the left once you get off the stop and be prepared to walk over a couple small bridges. We stayed in room 5. It was very big for European standards and spotlessly clean. Also had a nice view of the little courtyard. The bathroom was also very clean with all new Grohe fixtures. The breakfast was just rolls and coffee, but enough to get you started. The staff was very nice and helpful giving directions, pointers, etc. The walk to St. Marks's square is more like 15-20 minutes, but not a problem given the charm of all the little streets you pass by. Overall, we would definitely stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Alloggi Barbaria
